<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><a name="_Current_Announcements:"></a><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";color:red'>Current Announcements:
<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Tahoma","sans-serif";color:red'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpFirst style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>16Dec2015:
All student scores have been posted and distributed to EEE <span class=SpellE>GradeBook</span>
except “<span class=SpellE>ConnectK</span> Project” upon which we are
still working. PLEASE go to EEE immediately, verify that all of your grades are
correct, and notify all of us immediately if you detect any error.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>In
particular, please check your <span class=SpellE>ConnectK</span> Final Tournament
results. Student overcrowding has made this class tournament extremely
difficult. This is the largest CS-171 class that I have ever taught in my
>20 years with UC.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The last time
I ran this tournament, there were only 50 teams.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Now there are 133. Consequently, many
tournament tasks that were tedious but feasible to do manually before, are
completely infeasible to do manually now due to the greatly increased student
volume.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>The
difficulty you are seeing is due to UC overcrowding as a result of California
state underfunding.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>There is an
agreed funding formula, but the state of California has been falling further
and further behind in its agreed funding of UC ever since I have been at UCI.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The state of California insists that UC
accept more students, but does not provide funding for more faculty members.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The result is UC student overcrowding
and increases in the UC tuition you must pay. If you care, please express your
opinion as a citizen and a voter to your California state legislator.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>16Dec2015:
Thanks to the good efforts of the Tournament Staff (Reza <span class=SpellE>Asadi</span>,
Ahmad <span class=SpellE>Majomard</span>, and <span class=SpellE>Minhaeng</span>
Lee), the Final AI Tournament Rankings have been posted below in the <a
href="#_Project:_1">Project section</a> and are available <a
href="Final_Tournament_Results.xlsx">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>In
the end, the full round-robin tournament for which we hoped proved to be
infeasible due to its O(n^2) scaling in the face of student over-crowding.
Instead, we played each of your AIs against 10 other randomly chosen AIs, 6
games each (i.e., for each, 3 conditions X starting first and second). Each of
your resulting 60 games <span class=GramE>were</span> scored as +1 for a win, ½
for a tie, and 0 for a loss. Your resulting score across your 60 games
determined your decile ranking, which has been posted to EEE.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>8Dec2015:
The Final Exam answer key has been posted below and is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2015-fq-cs171-old-tests/2015-fq-cs-171-final-exam-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>1Dec2015:
The Quiz #4 answer key has been posted below and is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2015-fq-cs171-old-tests/2015-fq-cs-171-quiz-4-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>24Nov2015:
The Connect-K Final Report template has been posted below in the <a
href="#_Project:_1">Project section</a> and is available here [<a
href="../../AI-projects/connect-k/Connect-K-report-template.pdf">PDF</a>; <a
href="../../AI-projects/connect-k/Connect-K-report-template.docx">Word</a>].<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>24Nov2015:
Thanks to the good efforts of the Tournament Staff (Reza <span class=SpellE>Asadi</span>,
Ahmad <span class=SpellE>Majomard</span>, and <span class=SpellE>Minhaeng</span>
Lee), the <span class=SpellE>Wumpus</span> World Draft Tournament results have
been posted below in the <a href="#_Project:_1">Project section</a> and are
available <a href="Wumpus_Draft_Tournament_Results.txt">here</a>. The file
gives detailed results for 50 caves and aggregate results at the bottom. The
ranking was: 1. Irrational Agent ~ -17524; 2. <span class=SpellE>NoTeam</span>
~ -39248; 3. <span class=SpellE>Yurop</span> ~ -44217; 4. Dummy Agent ~ -46018;
5. <span class=SpellE>NewBee</span> ~ -50000. <span style='background:yellow;
mso-highlight:yellow'>However, some of the results seem perplexing and we are
looking into the matter further.</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>23Nov2015:
*PLEASE* do complete your student teaching evaluations for CS-171, Intro to AI.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Every student who fills out a course
evaluation for CS-171 will receive a bonus of 1% added to their final grade,
free and clear, off the curve, simply a bonus.</span><span style='font-family:
"Arial","sans-serif"'> EEE will return to me the names of students who fill out
evaluations (but not the content, which remains anonymous), provided that
enough students fill out evaluations so that anonymity is not compromised. <span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'> </span>I will add 1% free bonus to the final
grade of each such named student.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Student
course evaluations are very important to me for monitoring and improving the
course content, and very important to UCI for evaluating our success at our
educational mission. Many of the good features of CS-171 that you now enjoy
originally were suggested by previous CS-171 students on their student teaching
evaluations.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>I
do listen and respond to what you say.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>22Nov2015:
Thanks to the good efforts of the Tournament Staff (Reza <span class=SpellE>Asadi</span>,
Ahmad <span class=SpellE>Majomard</span>, and <span class=SpellE>Minhaeng</span>
Lee), detailed instructions for your Game AI submissions have been posted below
in the <a href="#_Project:_1">Project section</a> and are available <a
href="Instruction%20for%20ConnectK%20AI%20project.pptx">here</a>.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u>PLEASE,</u></b>
follow these instructions <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u>*scrupulously*</u></b>.
You may lose points if your failure to follow these instructions breaks our
scripts and so your Game AI cannot be run.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>20Nov2015:
The <span class=SpellE>ConnectK</span> Draft AI Results against <span
class=SpellE>AI_Poor</span>, <span class=SpellE>AI_Average</span>, and <span
class=SpellE>AI_Good</span>, plus the error log, have been posted below in the <a
href="#_Project:_1">Project section</a> and are available <a
href="ConnectK%20Draft%20AI%20Results%20Statistics.xlsx">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>19Nov2015:
The Quiz #3 answer key has been posted below and is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2015-fq-cs171-old-tests/2015-fq-cs-171-quiz-3-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>16Nov2015:
In response to a suggestion from a student, I have revised the pseudocode for
alpha-beta pruning to be clearer and more detailed. The revised pseudocode
appears as slides 18 & 19 in the lecture notes for Tue., 13 Oct., finish
Games/Adversarial Search, Games/Adversarial Search/Alpha-Beta Pruning. The
original pseudocode was taken from your textbook, Fig. 5.7, p. 170.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>While it is correct, I agree with the
student that it is so compressed that it is difficult to see the details.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>12Nov2015:
Due to technical difficulties with the very large number of teams, we have not
yet been able to get the Java error log (i.e., corresponding to the C++ error
log sent out earlier). Since it would be unfair to the Java teams to have less
time to fix their errors than the C++ teams, we are going to tweak the deadline
extension conditions (below) to be somewhat more favorable to you. All the
deadlines and conditions hold below *except* “a working draft AI”
is replaced by “a draft AI that you make work after the Tournament Staff
provides you with error feedback.”<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>12Nov2015:
A student pointed out that a blanket deadline extension was unfair to the
diligent hard-working teams who got their draft AI in by the original deadline.
Consequently, to reward diligent hard-working students, any team who got their
draft AI in by the original deadline will receive an extra-credit bonus of 5%
of your project points.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>10Nov2015:
As posted to the class mailing list,</span> <span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>The
CS-171 Tournament Staff has decided to give you a draft AI code-fixing deadline
extension with no grade penalty. The extended deadline with no grade penalty
for you to fix your code and submit a <b>*working*</b> draft AI is Fri., 13
Nov., 11:59pm. You will lose 10% of your project grade if your draft AI
submission misses that extended deadline. The <b>*absolute*</b> deadline beyond
which no draft AIs will be accepted is Sat., 14 Nov., 11:59pm. Just to be
clear: <br>
<span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>(1)
If you submit a <b>*working*</b> draft AI by Fri., 13 Nov., 11:59pm, there is
no grade penalty. <br>
<span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>(2)
If not, but you do submit a <b>*working*</b> draft AI by Sat., 14 Nov.,
11:59pm, you lose 10% of your project grade. <br>
<span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>(3)
If your <b>*working*</b> draft AI does not beat or tie <span class=SpellE>AI_poor</span>
in at least one of its six games, you lose 10% of your project grade. <br>
<span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>(4)
If you do <b>*not*</b> submit a working draft AI by Sat., 14 Nov., 11:59pm, you
lose 20% of your project grade (10% for being late plus 10% for failing to beat
or tie <span class=SpellE>AI_poor</span>).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>5Nov2015:
As posted to the class mailing list, TA and Tournament Director Reza <span
class=SpellE>Asadi</span> has clarified that below “run on the ICS lab
machines” means run on </span><a href="http://openlab.ics.uci.edu">openlab.ics.uci.edu</a>.<span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>5Nov2015:
EEE <span class=SpellE>DropBoxes</span> have been created for your Draft AIs.
Use “<span class=SpellE>ConnectK_Draft_AI</span>” for <span
class=SpellE>ConnectK</span> and “<span class=SpellE>Wumpus_Draft_AI</span>”
for <span class=SpellE>Wumpus</span> World. As stated below:</span> <span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-left:1.0in;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:Arial'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>1.<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>   
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Your
EEE <span class=SpellE>DropBox</span> submission must be a single
“zipped” file named “<span class=SpellE>yourLastName_yourUCINetID_yourTeamName</span>.”<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-left:1.0in;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:Arial'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>2.<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>   
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>It
should have three subdirectories: <span class=SpellE>src</span>, bin, &
doc; for source, executable, and documents (‘doc’ not required
now).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-left:1.0in;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:Arial'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>3.<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>   
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Please
deposit only one submission per team.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-left:1.0in;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:Arial'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>4.<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>   
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>If
your partner has deposited your submission, please deposit a text file stating
your name/ID, your partner’s name/ID, and your team name.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>5Nov2015:
Benchmark details for the <span class=SpellE>ConnectK</span> Project AI have
been posted to the Grading section below. Specifically:<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>*
You will lose 10% of your Project points if your AI does not beat or tie <span
class=SpellE>AI_Poor</span> in the Draft Tournament. It is sufficient to beat
or tie it in any one of your games.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>*
You will lose 20% of your Project points if your AI does not beat or tie <span
class=SpellE>AI_Poor</span> in the Final Tournament. It is sufficient to beat
or tie it in any one of your games.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>*
You will lose 10% of your Project points if your AI does not beat or tie <span
class=SpellE>AI_Average</span> in the Final Tournament (total loss of 30% if
your AI always loses to both <span class=SpellE>AI_Poor</span> and <span
class=SpellE>AI_Average</span>). It is sufficient to beat or tie it in any one
of your games.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>*
You will GAIN 10% BONUS of your Project points if your AI beats or ties <span
class=SpellE>AI_Good</span> in the Final Tournament. It is sufficient to beat
or tie it in any one of your games.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>*
The top 10% in the Final Tournament will receive 10% BONUS of your Project
points, the second 10% will receive 9% BONUS, <span class=GramE>the</span>
third 10% will receive 8% BONUS, and so on. <span style='background:yellow;
mso-highlight:yellow'>So, if you are clever and your AI is smart, you can
receive up to a total of 20% BONUS of your Project points.</span><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>3Nov2015:
The Mid-term Exam answer key has been posted below and is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2015-fq-cs171-old-tests/2015-fq-cs-171-midterm-exam-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>29Oct2015:
Thanks to the good efforts of Reza <span class=SpellE>Asadi</span>, CS-171 TA
and Tournament Director, there is a new Forum on our EEE <span class=SpellE>MessageBoard</span>:
“CS-171 Coding Projects Discussion.” This Forum is available for
CS-171 students to discuss various aspects of the coding projects as they go
along and reflect upon how, actually, to do it.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>27Oct2015:
Several students have asked how they can be <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><u>sure</u></b> that their AI will run on my cluster in the tournament.
The answer is that if it runs on the ICS lab machines (specifically, </span><a
href="http://openlab.ics.uci.edu">openlab.ics.uci.edu</a><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>) then it will run in the tournament.
Please be <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u>sure</u></b> that your AI
runs successfully on the ICS lab machines (</span><a
href="http://openlab.ics.uci.edu">openlab.ics.uci.edu</a>)<span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>27Oct2015:
As announced today in lecture and posted to the class email list, <span
class=SpellE>Minhaeng</span> Lee, CS-171 Reader, has concluded that the
included exe file depends on environment, so it may not be portable. His
suggestion, which we will adopt, is to drop exe files included in the fixed
code file and ask you to build your own exe files. The new version, without the
exe files, is available in the <a href="#_Project:_1">Project</a> section below
and also <a href="../../AI-projects/connect-k/CS_171_fixedCode_27oct2015.zip">here</a>
(please reload your browser page before accessing the new version). Please
build your own exe files.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>26Oct2015:
Several students have alerted me to further problems with the Connect-K
shell.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Thanks to <span
class=SpellE>Minhaeng</span> Lee, CS-171 Reader, these problems have been
fixed.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The new version is available
in the <a href="#_Project:_1">Project</a> section below and also <a
href="../../AI-projects/connect-k/CS_171_fixedCode_27oct2015.zip">here</a>
(please reload your browser page before accessing the new version).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>22Oct2015:
The Quiz #2 answer key has been posted below and is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2015-fq-cs171-old-tests/2015-fq-cs-171-quiz-2-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>20Oct2015:
For those of you unable to attend the ICS FACULTY PANEL ON IMPROVING YOUR GRAD
SCHOOL APPLICATION, the link to the video is <a
href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1IY8c4w5D6E">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>20Oct2015:
With gravity *on* the tournament game boards will be no larger than 10x10. With
gravity *off* the tournament game boards will be no larger than 7x7. In all
cases your AI will have five seconds to make its next move.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>16Oct2015:
Thanks to a kind and helpful student, plus the diligent efforts of the CS-171
Teaching Staff, the Java/C++ shell problem has been fixed. The fixed code is
available in the <a href="#_Project:_1">Project</a> section below and also <a
href="../../AI-projects/connect-k/CS_171_fixedCode.zip">here</a>. There still
appears to be a problem with the tournament Java/C++ shell and we hope to fix
that problem shortly.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>15Oct2015:
The <span class=SpellE>Wumpus</span> World shell has been released and is
available below in the <a href="#_Project:_1">Project</a> section or <a
href="../../AI-projects/wumpus-world/Wumpus%20World.zip">here</a>. See the <a
href="#_Project:_1">Project</a> section for details.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>15Oct2015:
In introducing heuristics I told an amusing story about Aristotle jumping out
of the public bath and running down the street shouting,
“Eureka!”<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>But, it turns
out that it actually was Archimedes, another famous ancient Greek.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>14Oct2015:
To clarify the interaction between IDS node reordering and value propagation in
<span class=SpellE>MiniMax</span> and Alpha-Beta Pruning, I have revised slides
36-43 of the lecture notes for Games/Adversarial Search/Alpha-Beta Pruning,
Tue., 13 Oct.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The basic ideas and
intuitions remain the same.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>However, I have made explicit the return value backpropagation so that
it is clearer why and where pruning is done.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>8Oct2015:
Please be sure to attend the Friday Discussion Section tomorrow, 9Oct2015. The
TA will discuss Game/Adversarial Search generally, and especially will lead a
discussion and answer questions on heuristic evaluation functions. The goal is
to help move you forward in your coding project.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>8Oct2015:
The Quiz #1 answer key has been posted below and is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2015-fq-cs171-old-tests/2015-fq-cs-171-quiz-1-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>6Oct2015:
The Connect-K coding shells and a collection of student coding resources <span
class=GramE>is</span> now available in the <a href="#_Project:_1">Project</a>
section below.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l4 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>6Oct2015:
The Discussion Section lecture slides for Fri., 3 Oct., have been posted below
and also are available here [<a
href="../cs171-lecture-slides/cs-171-Discussion-02-Search.pdf">PDF</a>; <a
href="../cs171-lecture-slides/cs-171-Discussion-02-Search.pptx">PPT</a>]. The
Discussion Section lecture slides for Fri., 25 Sep., are the same as the
Lecture Slides of Thu., 24 Sep., and also are available here [<a

<h2><a name="_Goal:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Goal:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:black'>The goal of this class is to familiarize you with the basic
principles of artificial intelligence. You will l</span><span style='font-size:
12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>earn <span style='color:black'>some
</span>basic AI techniques, the problems for which they are applicable, and
their limitations.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
course content is organized roughly around what are often considered to be
three central pillars of AI: Search, Logic, and Learning. Topics covered
include basic search, heuristic search, game search, constraint satisfaction,
knowledge representation, logic and inference, probabilistic modeling, and
machine learning algorithms. <o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<h2><a name="_Class_Setup:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Class Setup:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
course will be primarily lecture-based.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>There will be a Mid-term and a Final Exam.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>On most second Thursdays before the
Mid-term, or second Tuesdays after it, the first 20 minutes will be an in-class
pop quiz, followed by lecture (see specific dates in <a href="#_Syllabus:">Syllabus
below</a>).<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The frequent quizzes
are intended to encourage you to stay current with the course material.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><u>All exams and quizzes may cover all
material presented in class, including lectures and assigned textbook reading.</u><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Quizzes will cover mostly material
presented since the last quiz, and also may include questions that many
students missed on the previous quiz.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>The Final Exam will cover mostly material since the Mid-term Exam, and
also will include many questions intended to encourage you to remember the
earlier material (i.e., it <u>will </u>be comprehensive). <u>Please study the
previous CS-171 quizzes and exams (<a href="#_Study_Guides_---">below</a>),
which are made available as study guides to help you learn and master the class
material; they are important guides about the performance that will be expected
from you now.</u><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>There
will be an AI coding project and an optional extra-credit Bonus coding project
(see <a href="#_Projects:">Project section</a> below).<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You are allowed to do the project by
yourself, or you may form project teams of two students following the “<a
href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pair_programming">Pair Programming</a>”
paradigm.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please note that you are
encouraged to discuss concepts, methods, algorithms, etc.; but you are
forbidden to copy: (1) source code from any source, or (2) text from any source
unless properly cited and set off as a quote.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Except for class materials provided from
this class website, you must invent and write all of your own code by yourself
with your partner.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Except for
properly referenced material, you must write all of your own project report by
yourself with your partner. <span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Please
note that your source code and project report are subject to analysis by
automated plagiarism detection programs, and that direct copying will be
treated as an act of academic dishonesty (please see the section on “<a
href="#_Academic_Honesty:">Academic Honesty</a>” below). Please start
your AI coding project earlier than you believe necessary; it will take longer
and be more difficult than you expect (<u>as is true of all coding projects
everywhere at all times</u>).</span><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>All
my AI project shells were written by former CS-171 students who became
interested in AI and signed up for CS-199 in order to pursue their interest and
write more interesting AI project shells.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Please let me know if this is of interest to you (CS-171 grade of A- or
better required).<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Homework
will be assigned, but is not graded. The reason is that prior student course
evaluations alerted me to the existence of student cheating by way of copying
the homework answers.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I deplore
this degree of personal degradation in dishonest students, but I cannot control
it, and so I avoid the opportunity.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>I remain determined to create a fair and honest educational experience
for all students, as best I can.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=left>

</span></h2>

style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

back to the UCI Bookstore at the end if you don't want it for reference).</span>

trying to save a few dollars by not having a personal copy of the textbook.</span></b><span

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>Also,
for your convenience, I have requested that a copy of the textbook be placed on
reserve in the UCI Science Library.</span><strong><span style='font-weight:
normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> There is a two-hour check-out limit. </span></strong>However,
please understand that with high student enrollments, it is unrealistic to
expect that these thin reserves always will be available when you need
them.  <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='color:red'>Please
purchase or rent your own personal textbook.</span></b><strong><span
style='color:red;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>The AI coding project will be a Connect-K Game
controller.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>This project
corresponds to Game/Adversarial Search (Chapter 5 in your book). Your job is to
write an AI agent that can beat you at Connect-K, i.e., to write the
adversarial search (game search) controller for a game-playing agent. <o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>There will be a Draft and a Final Tournament within which
your AI controllers will compete against each other. Everyone’s AI will
be entered into the tournaments automatically. In the Final Tournament, Bonus
Points will be given based on how many games your AI wins against other AIs.
The top 10% winners will get 10% added to their project grade as a bonus; the
second 10% will get 9%; the third 10% will get 8%; and so on.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span class=SpellE><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>AI_Poor</span></span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>, <span
class=SpellE>AI_Average</span>, and <span class=SpellE>AI_Good</span> also will
be entered into the Draft and Final Tournaments (these AIs are available in the
"student coding resources" part of the Project section of the class
website). In the Draft Tournament, you will lose points if your AI controller
does not beat or tie <span class=SpellE>AI_Poor</span>. In the Final
Tournament, you will lose points if your AI controller does not beat or tie <span
class=SpellE>AI_Poor</span> and <span class=SpellE>AI_Average</span>, and you
will win Bonus Points if your AI controller beats or ties <span class=SpellE>AI_Good</span>.
It is sufficient to beat or tie them in any one of your games with them. Specifically:<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>*
You will lose 10% of your Project points if your AI does not beat or tie <span
class=SpellE>AI_Poor</span> in the Draft Tournament. It is sufficient to beat
or tie it in any one of your games.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>*
You will lose 20% of your Project points if your AI does not beat or tie <span
class=SpellE>AI_Poor</span> in the Final Tournament. It is sufficient to beat
or tie it in any one of your games.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>*
You will lose 10% of your Project points if your AI does not beat or tie <span
class=SpellE>AI_Average</span> in the Final Tournament (total loss of 30% if
your AI always loses to both <span class=SpellE>AI_Poor</span> and <span
class=SpellE>AI_Average</span>). It is sufficient to beat or tie it in any one
of your games.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>*
You will GAIN 10% BONUS of your Project points if your AI beats or ties <span
class=SpellE>AI_Good</span> in the Final Tournament. It is sufficient to beat
or tie it in any one of your games.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>*
The top 10% in the Final Tournament will receive 10% BONUS of your Project
points, the second 10% will receive 9% BONUS, <span class=GramE>the</span>
third 10% will receive 8% BONUS, and so on. <span style='background:yellow;
mso-highlight:yellow'>So, if you are clever and your AI is smart, you can
receive up to a total of 20% BONUS of your Project points.</span><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo8'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>As explained in class email, an extra-credit Bonus coding
project will be offered that is a newer and more interesting coding project
shell, and currently is available only in Java.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>(I offer Independent Research credits to
any student interested in writing the corresponding C++ or Python shells; grade
of A- or better in CS-171 is required.)<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>It is an "agent AI controller" for the <span class=SpellE>Wumpus</span>
World, in both logical-agent and probabilistic-agent versions.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>As above, you will write the
"smarts" for what is initially a dumb shell, we will run a tournament
at the end of class, and the winners will get Bonus Points.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo9'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Every student who fills out a course evaluation
for CS-171 will receive a bonus of 1% added to their final grade, free and
clear, off the curve, simply a bonus.</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>        </span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>EEE will
return to me the names of students who fill out evaluations (but not the
content, which remains anonymous), provided that enough students fill out
evaluations so that anonymity is not compromised.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I will add 1% free bonus to the final
grade of each such named student.</span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>        </span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Student
course evaluations are very important to me for monitoring and improving the
course content, and very important to UCI for evaluating our success at our
educational mission.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>*Please* fill
out your student course evaluations.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo9'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>“Bonus Points” will be awarded, at my sole
discretion, (1) to the first student who spots a genuine technical error (typos
don’t count) in any of the course materials before I spot it too, and (2)
for helpful contributions to the class as we go along.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>One bonus point is equivalent to one
quiz point.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>Your
Bonus Points, if any, should be visible to you in EEE <span class=SpellE>GradeBook</span>.
If for some reason you have been awarded a Bonus Point, but you did not get a
notification from me or it did not appear in EEE <span class=SpellE>GradeBook</span>,
please do not hesitate to send an email message to me as a reminder.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

</div>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><a name="_Study_Habits:"></a><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Study Habits:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>This course is technical, rigorous, and
demanding. You will be expected to learn and master a large body of technical
material in a very short period of <span class=GramE>time,</span> and to
demonstrate your mastery by (1) accurate performance on frequent quizzes and
exams, and (2) successful implementation of an AI coding project.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Although
I deliberately treat you as adults who are responsible for your own educational
decisions, and so lecture and discussion sections are optional ---
nevertheless, students who do not attend lecture or discussion sections are at
a serious disadvantage and do not succeed as well in this class.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>They send me emails asking questions
that already were covered thoroughly and in detail during lecture and again in
discussion section.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>They miss
points on quizzes and exams that already have been discussed thoroughly. <u>Your
educational moments are precious, and your education now will be the single
most important factor in your future career success or failure.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please, make the most of your precious
educational moments now; please, attend both lecture and discussion section.</u><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Please
do not ever fall behind in the class material; instead, <u>study frequently and
diligently</u>. Please begin your AI coding project earlier than you believe
necessary; it will take longer and be more difficult than you expect (<u>as is
true of all coding projects everywhere at all times</u>).<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Please
work harder and study longer.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Please understand thoroughly all class material, and ask questions when
you do not understand.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please
attend all lectures and discussion sections.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please come to lectures and discussion
sections prepared with questions about any material that is not clear.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please do all assigned reading, both
before and again after lecture. Please review the lecture notes, several times
over, both before and again after lecture, until you understand every detail.
Please regularly attend office hours with me and the TA. Please ask questions
about any class material that is not absolutely crystal clear.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Please
<u>work and understand all past quizzes and exams; they are important guides
about the performance that will be expected from you now.</u> Please work and
understand all the optional homework.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Please
<u>OVERSTUDY!!</u><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><a name="_Syllabus:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Syllabus:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p><b>The following represents a preliminary syllabus. Some changes in the
lecture sequence may occur due to earthquakes, fires, floods, wars, natural
disasters, unnatural disasters, or the discretion of the instructor based on
class progress.<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p><b>Background Reading and Lecture Slides will be changed or revised as the
class progresses at the discretion of the instructor.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please note:<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I may tweak or revise the lecture slides
prior to the lecture; please ensure that you have the current version.<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p><b>Please read the assigned textbook reading and review the lecture notes <span
style='color:red'>in advance </span>of each lecture, then <span
style='color:red'>again after </span>each lecture.<o:p></o:p></b></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:
3'>                                    </span>The
program learns to build a car using a genetic algorithm. <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:
3'>                                    </span>If
you let this program run for a long time (>> 30 generations), you will
see that eventually it produces cars well suited to the terrain. This outcome
illustrates a general theme of genetic algorithms: very, very slow; but,
eventually, good performance. After all, it took ~3.6 billion years to evolve
humans from bacteria (<a
href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timeline_of_evolutionary_history_of_life">http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timeline_of_evolutionary_history_of_life</a>).
Please note that this eventual good performance of genetic algorithms is
conditional upon a representation that allows good solutions to sub-problems to
be combined simply, by cross-over, into a globally good solution; if the vector
position of the features is completely randomized within the chromosome, any
such good performance is lost.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt'><span
style='mso-tab-count:2'>                        </span></span><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>“<a
href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Technological_singularity">Technological
singularity</a>” --- Wikipedia.</span></span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-1.5in'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>                                    </span>“The
technological singularity hypothesis is that accelerating progress in
technologies will cause a runaway effect wherein artificial intelligence will
exceed human intellectual capacity and control, thus radically changing or even
ending civilization in an event called the singularity.”<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:2'>                        </span><span
class=GramE>“<a
href="http://www-rohan.sdsu.edu/faculty/vinge/misc/singularity.html">The Coming
Technological Singularity: How to Survive in the Post-Human Era</a>” (c)
1993 by <span class=SpellE>Vernor</span> <span class=SpellE>Vinge</span>.</span><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:3'>                                    </span>(Verbatim
copying/translation and distribution of this entire article <span class=GramE>is</span>
permitted in any medium, provided this notice is preserved.)<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>    </span><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-1.5in'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:2'>                                                </span>“Abstract:<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>     </span>Within thirty years,
we will have the technological means to create superhuman intelligence. Shortly
after, the human era will be ended.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Is such progress avoidable? If not to be avoided, can events be guided
so that we may survive?<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>These
questions are investigated. Some possible answers (and some further dangers)
are presented.”<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-1.5in'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:2'>                                                </span>“....
Just so I'm not guilty of a relative-time ambiguity, let me more specific: I'll
be surprised if this event occurs before 2005 or after 2030....”<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'>16Dec2015: Thanks to the good
efforts of the Tournament Staff (Reza <span class=SpellE>Asadi</span>, Ahmad <span
class=SpellE>Majomard</span>, and <span class=SpellE>Minhaeng</span> Lee)<span
class=GramE>,</span> the Final AI Tournament Rankings are available <a
href="Final_Tournament_Results.xlsx">here</a>. In the end, the full round-robin
tournament for which we hoped proved to be infeasible due to its O(n^2) scaling
in the face of student over-crowding. Instead, we played each of your AIs
against 10 other randomly chosen AIs, 6 games each (i.e., for each, 3
conditions X starting first and second). Each of your resulting 60 games <span
class=GramE>were</span> scored as +1 for a win, ½ for a tie, and 0 for a
loss. Your resulting score across your 60 games determined your decile ranking,
which has been posted to EEE.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>This project
corresponds to Game Search (Chapter 5 in your book). Your job is to write an AI
agent that can beat you at Connect-K, i.e., to write the adversarial search
(game search) controller for a video game world. Shells will be available in
C++ and Java.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>We will run a
tournament within which your AI controllers will compete against each other for
Bonus Points. Everyone’s AI will be entered in the tournament
automatically; the bonus points are simply free, based on how many games your
AI wins against other AIs. The top 10% winners will get 10% added to their
project grade as a bonus; the second 10% will get 9%; the third 10% will get
8%; and so on.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>With gravity *on* the
tournament game boards will be no larger than 10x10. With gravity *off* the
tournament game boards will be no larger than 7x7. In all cases your AI will
have five seconds to make its next move.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>An <a
href="../../AI-projects/connect-k/ConnectFINAL_cpp/SampleExecutable/SampleConnect.exe">example
dumb game is available</a>; an <a
href="../../AI-projects/connect-k/ConnectFINAL_cpp/FullExecutable/Connect.exe">example
smart game is available</a>; a collection of <a
href="../../AI-projects/connect-k/CS171ConnectKStudentResources">student coding
resources is available</a>. <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;background:yellow;
mso-highlight:yellow'>Please note:</span></b><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>
We'll run the tournament on SGE or a lab machine. The C++ target platform
should be x86. You should write your code to run on any x86 <span class=GramE>machine</span>.
The OS is CentOS 6. We most likely will need to compile your code with CentOS 6
(RHEL 6) x86_64. Machines in the openlab.ics.uci.edu (family-guy.ics.uci.edu)
are CentOS 6. Your code should run on </span></b><a
href="http://openlab.ics.uci.edu">openlab.ics.uci.edu</a>.<b><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;background:yellow;
mso-highlight:yellow'>Please note:</span></b><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>
Connect-K, like most board games of its type, has a built-in advantage to the
first player (e.g., chess grandmasters try to win if they are white and play
first; they try to draw if they are black and play second). A
“fairer” game would have the first player make one move; then the
second player make two moves; then the first player make two moves; and so on,
alternately making two moves each, to neutralize the first-move advantage. The
point of this exercise is for you to write a “smart” AI, not to win
board games; nevertheless, be sure to run your AI both as first and second
player, then average the results.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;background:yellow;
mso-highlight:yellow'>Please note:</span></b><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>
The shells may change as the quarter progresses.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>If so, we will try to keep the interface
the same, so that all you need do is change the surrounding shell.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>This project
corresponds to Propositional Logic (Chapter 7 in your book) and Quantifying
Uncertainty (Chapter 13 in your book). Your job is to write logic-based and
probability-based agents for the <span class=SpellE>Wumpus</span> World (Chapter
7.2 in your book). This is a new project, and only a Java shell is available.
You will receive an extra-credit bonus for doing this project. Additionally, we
will run a <span class=SpellE>Wumpus</span> World project similar to the
Connect-K tournament above, within which your AI controllers will compete
against each other for Bonus Points.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>The <span class=SpellE>Wumpus</span>
World project shell has been released and is available <a
href="../../AI-projects/wumpus-world/Wumpus%20World.zip">here</a>. It contains
“dummy” and “irrational” agent shells that you will
make smarter, a <span class=SpellE>Wumpus</span> World GUI that enforces the
“laws of physics,” and a knowledge base agent that supports
“tell” and “ask” for propositional logic (note: prefix
form input). You can run your agent against given/random caves and watch it explore,
or in tournament mode to play against your other candidate agents or your
friends’ agents.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>You may submit both a <span
class=SpellE>PropLogic</span> agent and a Probability agent to the <span
class=SpellE>Wumpus</span> World tournament.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You will win Bonus Points in the
tournament as above. Rankings will be established by running every agent
against the same thousand caves and averaging its scores. The agent performance
measure is the score system given in your textbook. We might run the <span
class=SpellE>PropLogic</span> agents and the Probability agents separately
because the Probability agents are expected to be strictly more powerful.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'><o:p> </o:p></span></b></p>

<h2><a name="_Study_Guides_---"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Arial","sans-serif";color:red'>Study Guides --- Previous CS-171 Quizzes,
Mid-term, and Final exams:</span><span class=MsoHyperlink><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:windowtext;
font-weight:normal;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Previous CS-171
Quizzes, Mid-term exams, and Final exams are available here as study guides.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>As an
incentive to study this material, at least one question from a previous Quiz or
Exam will appear on every new Quiz or Exam. In particular, questions that many
students missed are likely to appear again. If you missed a question, please
study it carefully and learn from your mistake --- so that if it appears again,
you will understand it perfectly.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Please note
that some of the very old tests below reflect different textbooks that may
define some things differently than does your current textbook. In case of
conflict, your current textbook is deemed correct and will prevail. Some of
your visualization systems may not display the red PDF overlays used to correct
errors in very old tests. For example, in problems #2a, #2c, #3a, and #3b on
Quiz #2 from SQ’2004, the PDF overlay is invisible on a Mac (iPad), and
possibly on some other systems or printers.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The PDF overlays just do not seem to
work as advertised (sorry!!), but this problem seems only to afflict very old
tests (i.e., from over a decade ago). If you are confused by any of the answers
below, please bring your questions to the TA in Discussion Section.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>If you find a genuine error anywhere,
please send me email and you will receive a Bonus Point if correct.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Also, a
student has recommended ‘quizlet.com’ as a good online study
resource. While I cannot vouch for it, apparently it contains several good
study aids for your textbook.</span><span class=MsoHyperlink><span
style='color:windowtext;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

answer to Quiz #2 (3a) is N.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h2><a name="_Academic_Honesty:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Arial","sans-serif";color:red'>Academic Honesty: </span><span
class=MsoHyperlink><span style='color:windowtext;text-decoration:none;
text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Academic dishonesty is unacceptable
and will not be tolerated at the University of California, Irvine. It is the
responsibility of each student to be familiar with UCI's current academic
honesty policies. Please take the time to read the current <a
href="http://senate.uci.edu/uci-academic-senate-manual/part-iii-appendices-of-the-irvine-division/appendix-viii-uci-academic-senate-policy-on-academic-honesty/">UCI
Academic Senate Policy <span class=GramE>On</span> Academic Integrity</a> and
the <a href="https://www.ics.uci.edu/ugrad/policies/Academic_Honesty.php">ICS
School Policy on Academic Honesty</a>.</span></b></p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>The
policies in these documents will be adhered to scrupulously. Any student who
engages in cheating, forgery, dishonest conduct, plagiarism, or collusion in
dishonest activities, will receive an academic evaluation of ``F'' for the
entire course, with a letter of explanation to the student's permanent file.
The <a href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/grad/sao/index.php">ICS Student Affairs
Office</a> will be involved at every step of the process. Dr. Lathrop seeks to
create a level playing field for all students.</span></b></p>
